biotools.summary: iMPP is a tool designed to predict and assemble peptides from short fragmentary reads. iMPP is written in C++ and has been tested on a 64-bit Linux system. The input for the software are FASTQ sequences, and the output comprises of 4 files: 1. predicted genes (nucl), 2. predicted peptides (prot), 3. gene predictions in gff format, 4. assembled peptide sequences (prot).
